title: Actor Hugh Sheridan reveals he goes nude in Hair The Musical
text:
He's currently starring in the stage production Hair The Musical as George Berger.

And on Thursday, Hugh Sheridan revealed that he gets to push the boundaries when it comes to playing his character on stage.

Speaking on Nova’s Kate, Tim & Marty show, the 34-year-old said: 'I'm doing the full frontal naked.'

I'm doing the full frontal naked!' Hugh Sheridan (pictured) revealed that he gets to push the boundaries when it comes to playing George Berger in Hair The Musical

Hugh added that his co-star Prinnie Stevens, who plays the role of Shelia, also bares all in the live show.

'She [Prinnie] sometimes does the nudity but not always, just depends on her mood,' he continued.

The Packed To The Rafters star took the stage on Thursday night alongside co-stars including singer Paulini, to launch the musical at Sydney's Opera House.

Exciting: Hugh (pictured in character) took the stage on Thursday night to launch the musical at Sydney's Opera House alongside co-stars Paulini and Prinnie Stevens

'She sometimes does the nudity': Hugh also said that co-star Prinnie Stevens (pictured), who plays the role of Shelia, bares all in the live show

Taking to Instagram, he shared a snap of himself standing on the steps of the venue and looking into the distance.

'It’s my third time this year to have an opening night in the Sydney Opera House concert hall,' he captioned the post.

I can’t tell you how amazingly lucky I feel to tread the boards on this most beautiful theatre,' he added.

Hugh wrote on Instagram: 'I get to play a very naughty and big hearted character ...I even get to smoke and be completely naked in front of a few thousand people'

He continued: 'Only tonight I get to play a very naughty and big hearted character Burger in @hairthemusicalau I even get to smoke and be completely naked in front of a few thousand people.'

Hair The Musical is set in the 1960s amid 'hippie counter culture, free-love eschewed conformity and experimentation,' the website explains.

The show will play at the Sydney Opera House until Sunday October, 6.
